captions.text:
-HI, we are Brooklyn
and Bailey here.

And we are going to do
our May book review.

It's like, Brooklyn and
Bailey book reviews!

-So when we were 3
and 1/2 years old,
my mom first taught us to read.

And ever since then we've
just been major readers.

We would always
go to our teachers

-For instance, like last
book review-- Goose Girl,

was actually an
assignment in class.

Sorry, I can't
even say that word.

Anyways, it was an
assignment from our teacher.

And it became my
favorite story ever.

-I remember I didn't want
to read that book at first,

So it's just like,
we love books.

And I get all of
my recommendations

-You really have to
start liking reading

when you find good books that
you're actually interested in.

-If you find boring books, then
reading's kind of like a eh.
Like, you don't wanna do it.

But if you find good books,
it's totally worth it,

Today we are doing our
May book review with us.

And so why don't you
start with your book.

Very good book by
Aprilynne Pike.

It was about a girl named
Laurel who has a normal life.

But then she finds out one day
that she's a fairy, because she

And it's about how she
meets this fairy guy.

-And he like, knows
all her history.

So she's really
interested in him.

So then she gets into this whole
fairy world, and all the fairy
And its a really good book.

-For any fantasy lovers,
this is a good book.

And this one is called The
Girl of Fire and Thorns.

It's kind of about
a girl named Elisa

who was born with a gemstone
on her belly button.

And that sounds really
weird right now,

but it's actually really
important in the book.
It means that she's born for--

And everyone thinks that
her sister is more--

Because in this book
she's considered obese.

So her dad marries her
off to this foreign king.

-And the foreign
king is about to go

into this war with this
other warring country.

-It's a kind of
adventure with this.

She's kind of being pulled
in between kingdoms.

So those are our books
for our May book review.

Don't forget to comment below
on your favorite genre of books.

-And don't forget to subscribe
to our YouTube channel.
There's a button there for you.

Anyways, we will see
you guys next week.

title: May Book Review | Brooklyn and Bailey

comments.text:
My favorite genre of books is definitely mystery {and a pinch of romance -- 
really, who doesn't enjoy a romantic touch} particularly Mary Downing Hahn 
novels, which include Deep Dark & Dangerous, Closed For The Season, and 
many more! Check 'em out :)﻿

comments.text:
You should read the book In A Heartbeat by Loretta Ellsworth. It's about 
this girl that has heart problems and has to get a new heart and that's all 
I can really tell you about the book because if I tell you any more then 
I'll spoil it for you, which I don't want to do. This book is told from two 
different people like the chapters switch off people and yeah. But it's a 
really good book and I rate it a 5 out of 5 so please read it, it's 
amazing!!﻿
